text: The Horrors of the Day of Resurrection: Many verses of the Quran affirm that massive astronomical events will take place on that Day. All of them point to a complete change in the system binding the parts of this visible universe, its orbits, and its stars. And to an inversion in its conditions, forms, and connections, marking the end of this world. It is an inversion not limited to the Earth, but includes the stars, planets, and orbits. Allah Almighty said: {When the sun is wrapped up (1) And when the stars fall, dispersing (2) And when the mountains are removed (3) And when full-term she-camels are neglected (4) And when the wild beasts are gathered (5) And when the seas are filled with flame (6)} [Surah At-Takwir: 1-6], ... {When the sky breaks apart (1) And when the planets fall, scattering (2) And when the seas are erupted (3) And when the [contents of] graves are scattered (4)} [Surah Al-Infitar: 1-4], ... {When the sky has split (1) And has listened to its Lord and was obligated [to do so] (2) And when the earth has been extended (3) And has cast out that within it and relinquished [it] (4) And has listened to its Lord and was obligated [to do so] (5)} [Surah Al-Inshiqaq: 1-5], ... {And when the heaven is split open and becomes rose-colored like oil} [Ar-Rahman: 37], ... {When the earth is shaken with convulsion (4) And the mountains are broken down, crumbling (5) And become dust dispersing} [Surah Al-Waqi'ah: 4-6], ... {Then when the Horn is blown with one blast (13) And the earth and the mountains are lifted and leveled with one blow (14) Then on that Day, the Resurrection will occur (15) And the heaven will split [open], for that Day it is infirm (16)} [Surah Al-Haqqah: 13-16], ... {The Day the sky will be like murky oil (8) And the mountains will be like wool} [Surah Al-Ma'arij: 8-9], ... {When the earth is shaken with its [final] earthquake (1) And the earth discharges its burdens (2)} [Surah Az-Zalzalah: 1-2], ... {It is the Day people will be like moths, dispersed (4) And the mountains will be like wool, fluffed up (5)} [Surah Al-Qari'ah: 4-5], ... {Then watch for the Day when the sky will bring a visible smoke (10) Covering the people; this is a painful punishment (11)} [Surah Ad-Dukhan: 10-11], ... {On the Day the earth and the mountains will convulse and the mountains will become a heap of sand pouring down (14)} [Al-Muzzammil: 14], ... {The heaven will break apart therefrom; ever is His promise fulfilled (18)} [Al-Muzzammil: 18], ... {When the earth has been leveled - pounded and crushed (21) And your Lord has come} [Al-Fajr: 21], ... {So when vision is dazzled (7) And the moon darkens (8) And the sun and the moon are joined (9)} [Surah Al-Qiyamah: 7-9], ... {Then when the stars are obliterated (8) And when the heaven is cleft asunder (9) And when the mountains are blown away (10)} [Surah Al-Mursalat: 8-10], ... {And they ask you about the mountains, so say, "My Lord will blow them away with a blast. (105) And He will leave the earth a level plain; (106) You will not see therein a depression or an elevation." (107)} [Surah Ta-Ha: 105-107], ... {And you see the mountains, thinking them rigid, while they will pass as the passing of clouds} [An-Naml: 88], ... {And the Day We will cause the mountains to pass away and you will see the earth prominent} [Al-Kahf: 47], ... {[It will be] on the Day the earth will be replaced by another earth, and the heavens [as well]} [Ibrahim: 48], ... {The Day We will fold the heaven like the folding of a [written] sheet for the records} [Al-Anbiya: 104], ... {And the Day the heaven will split open with [emerging] clouds, and the angels will be sent down in successive descent (25) True sovereignty, that Day, is for the Most Merciful. And it will be upon the disbelievers a difficult Day (26)} [Surah Al-Furqan: 25-26]. All these verses predict that the end of this world will be a horrific end, in which the earth will quake and be leveled, the mountains will be blown away, and the seas will explode. Likewise, the stars will be obliterated and fall, the sky will split and break apart, the planets will shatter and scatter, distances will be disrupted bringing the sun and moon together, and the sky will appear sometimes like smoke and sometimes red flaming... up to the end of this terrible cosmic horror... {And it will be upon the disbelievers a difficult Day (26)} [Al-Furqan: 26] with what it contains of terror and what it contains of punishment.

text: And He Almighty has described the situation of Resurrection with the severity of all that (1), as He Almighty said: {Do they not think that they will be resurrected (4) For a tremendous Day - (5) The Day when mankind will stand before the Lord of the worlds?} [Surah Al-Mutaffifin: 4-6], and He Almighty said: {And never think that Allah is unaware of what the wrongdoers do. He only delays them for a Day when eyes will stare [in horror]. (42) Racing ahead, their heads raised up, their glance does not come back to them, and their hearts are void (43)} [Surah Ibrahim: 42-43], and He Almighty said: {To Him in a Day the extent of which is fifty thousand years} [Al-Ma'arij: 4] - up to His saying - {(9) And no friend will ask [anything of] a friend, (10) They will be shown each other. The criminal will wish that he could be ransomed from the punishment of that Day by his children (11) And his wife and his brother (12) And his nearest kindred who shelter him (13) And whoever is on earth entirely [so] then it could save him (14)} [Surah Al-Ma'arij: 10-14], and He Almighty said: {The Horn (8) That Day will be a difficult day (9) For the disbelievers, not easy} [Surah Al-Muddaththir: 9-10], and He Almighty said: {And fear a Day whose evil will be widespread (7)} [Al-Insan: 7] - up to His saying - {Indeed, We fear from our Lord a Day austere and distressful. (10) So Allah will protect them from the evil of that Day and give them radiance and happiness (11)} [Surah Al-Insan: 10-11], and He Almighty said: {Indeed, these [disbelievers] love the immediate and leave behind them a grave Day (27)} [Al-Insan: 27]. In the Sahih from Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, from the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, who said: «The Day when mankind will stand before the Lord of the worlds, he said: One of them will stand in his sweat up to halfway to his ears» (2). Topic Two: The Nearness of the Sun to the Creatures Part of belief in the Last Day is to believe that the sun will draw near to the creatures by the measure of a mile. The mile could mean the needle of the kohl container, or it could mean the distance measure on earth. Whether it is the kohl needle or the distance mile, the sun will be close to the heads. From Al-Miqdad, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: «The sun will be brought near the creation on the Day of Resurrection until it is about a mile from them. People will be in sweat according to their deeds; some will be in sweat up to their ankles, some up to their knees, some up to their waists (3), and some will be bridled by sweat completely» (4). Topic Three: Holding Creatures Accountable for Their Deeds Also included in belief in the Last Day is believing that creatures will be held accountable for their deeds. Allah named the Day of Resurrection the Day of Reckoning, because it is the day man is held accountable for his work. The reckoning is a reckoning of favor, kindness, and generosity for the believer; for Allah, Glory be to Him and the Most High, takes account of the believer, secludes him, places His covering over him - meaning His screen - and makes him confess his sins, saying to him: You did such and such on such and such day, until he admits and confesses. When he admits and confesses, Allah, Glory be to Him and the Most High, says to him: «I screened it for you in the world and I forgive it for you today» (5). As for the disbelievers - and we seek refuge in Allah - they are not reckoned with this reckoning, rather they are confronted with their deeds, and He says: You did such and such. If they deny, their tongues, hands, and feet testify against them regarding what they used to do. Even the skins testify, so they say to their skins: {And they will say to their skins, "Why have you testified against us?" They will say, "We were made to speak by Allah, who has made everything speak; and He created you the first time, and to Him you are returned. (21) And you were not covering yourselves, lest your hearing testify against you or your sight or your skins, but you assumed that Allah does not know much of what you do. (22) And that was your assumption which you assumed about your Lord. It has brought you to ruin, and you have become among the losers." (23) So [even] if they are patient, the Fire is a residence for them; and if they ask to appease [Allah], they will not be of those who are allowed to appease (24)} [Surah Fussilat: 21-24]. The disbelievers confront their deeds and are disgraced by them, and it is called out before the witnesses: {These are the ones who lied about their Lord; unquestionably, the curse of Allah is upon the wrongdoers (18)} [Hud: 18]. A multitude that none can count but Allah is saved from this reckoning. The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: «His nation was presented to him, and among them are seventy thousand who will enter Paradise without reckoning or punishment; they are those who do not seek Ruqyah (incantations), do not use branding (cauterization), do not believe in bad omens, and rely upon their Lord» (6).

text: Topic Four: The Balance (Mizan) What is included in belief in the Last Day: The Balance. Allah Almighty said: {And the weighing [of deeds] that Day will be the truth} [Al-A'raf: 8], and He Almighty said: {And We place the scales of justice for the Day of Resurrection} [Al-Anbiya: 47]. The Balance according to Ahl al-Sunnah is a real balance by which the deeds of servants are weighed. Ibn Hajar said: "Al-Zajjaj said: Ahl al-Sunnah agreed on belief in the Balance, and that the deeds of servants are weighed by it on the Day of Resurrection, and that the Balance has a tongue and two pans and tilts with deeds" (1). (The mention of weighing and scales has appeared in many verses of the Quran, and the sum of texts indicates that the worker, the work, and the scroll are weighed, and there is no contradiction between them, for all are weighed, but the consideration in heaviness and lightness is by the deed itself, not by the essence of the worker nor by the scroll, and Allah knows best) (2). And recompensing people for their deeds, their Jinn and their humans, Allah sets up the scales and weighs the deeds of servants. So this one's scale is heavy and he is the happy one, and this one's scale is light and he is the perished one. And this one is given his book in his right hand and he is the happy one, and this one is given his book in his left hand and he is the wretched one, we ask Allah for safety and well-being. Scholars differed regarding the Balance: is it one or multiple? There are two opinions; this is because the texts came regarding the Balance sometimes in singular and sometimes in plural, like His saying Almighty: {And We place the scales [Mawazin - plural] of justice} [Al-Anbiya: 47], and singular in like his saying, peace and blessings be upon him: «Two words... heavy in the Balance [Mizan - singular]» (3). Some scholars said: The Balance is one, and it is pluralized in consideration of what is weighed or in consideration of the nations, so this Balance weighs the deeds of the nation of Muhammad, the deeds of the nation of Musa, the deeds of the nation of Isa, and so on; thus the Balance is pluralized considering the multiplicity of nations. Those who said it is multiple in itself said: Because this is the basic principle in plurality, and it is possible that Allah Almighty makes a balance for every nation or makes a balance for obligatory deeds and a balance for voluntary deeds. What appears - and Allah knows best - is that the intention is that the Balance is one, but it is multiple in consideration of what is weighed (4).

book_title: The Doctrine of Belief in the Last Day and Its Effect on Reforming Society
text: Topic Five: Spreading of the Books And included in belief in the Last Day is: The spreading of the registers, which are the Books. They are spread among people, so people differ in taking these books; some take them with the right hand, and some take them with the left. Allah Almighty said: {So as for he who is given his record in his right hand, he will say, "Here, read my record! (19) Indeed, I was certain that I would be meeting my account." (20) So he will be in a pleasant life - (21) In an elevated garden, (22) Its [fruit] to be picked hanging near. (23) [They will be told], "Eat and drink in satisfaction for what you put forth in the days past." (24) But as for he who is given his record in his left hand, he will say, "Oh, I wish I had not been given my record (25) And had not known what is my account. (26)} [Surah Al-Haqqah: 19-26]. And He Almighty said: {But as for he who is given his record behind his back (10)} [Al-Inshiqaq: 10], meaning: he takes it with his left hand, but the left hand is dislocated to the back from behind his back. The recompense is of the same nature as the deed; just as this man put the Book of Allah behind his back, he is given his book on the Day of Resurrection from behind his back, a fitting recompense. This book has written in it what the human does, as He Almighty said: {No! But you deny the Recompense. (9) And indeed, [appointed] over you are keepers, (10) Noble and recording; (11)} [Surah Al-Infitar: 9-11], and it is said to the human: {Read your record. Sufficient is yourself against you this Day as accountant (14)} [Al-Isra: 14]. Topic Six: The Cistern (Al-Hawd) And included in belief in the Last Day is: The Cistern, the Cistern of the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him. This Cistern is a vast cistern, its length is a month['s journey] and its width is a month['s journey]. Its vessels are like the stars of the sky in their number and beauty. Its water is whiter than milk, sweeter than honey, and more fragrant than the scent of musk. Whoever drinks a drink from it will never be thirsty again. The Cistern derives its water from Al-Kawthar, which is a river given to the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, in Paradise; two spouts pour from it into the Cistern, so the Cistern remains always full. The believers from the nation of the Messenger, peace and blessings be upon him, come to it and drink from it. This Cistern is in the courts of the Resurrection during the intense heat and the people's fatigue, worry, and distress, so they drink from this Cistern after which they will never thirst again. From Abdullah bin Amr, may Allah be pleased with them both, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: «My Cistern is a month's journey, its corners are equal, its water is whiter than silver (Wariq), its scent is better than musk, and its cups are like the stars of the sky; whoever drinks from it will never thirst again» (1). (The time of the Cistern is before crossing the Sirat, because the situation requires that, since people are in need of drinking in the courts of the Resurrection before crossing the Sirat) (2).

book_title: The Doctrine of Belief in the Last Day and Its Effect on Reforming Society
text: Topic Seven: Intercession (Shafa'ah) And included in belief in the Last Day is: Intercession. It is of two types: One: Exclusive to the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him. The Second: General for him and for all Prophets, Truthful ones (Siddiqin), Martyrs, and Righteous people. As for the Intercession Exclusive to the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him -: First: The Great Intercession which is for judgment among the people. That is because people on the Day of Resurrection will be afflicted with distress, worry, and grief that they cannot bear, because they remain for fifty thousand years, with the sun above their heads, and sweat may bridle some of them, so they find worry, grief, and distress. They seek someone to intercede for them to Allah Almighty to save them from that. Allah Almighty inspires them to go to Adam, who is the father of mankind. They come to him and ask him for intercession, but he excuses himself saying he disobeyed his Lord by eating from the tree which Allah forbade him to eat from; because the station of intercession is a great station requiring the intercessor to be free of everything, for he is an intercessor wanting to mediate for another, so if he is sinful, how can he be an intercessor? So people go to Nuh (Noah), peace be upon him, and ask him for intercession, but he excuses himself saying he asked for what he had no knowledge of, and he had asked Allah Almighty to save his disbelieving son from drowning, so he excuses himself. Then they come to Ibrahim (Abraham), the Friend of the Most Merciful, peace be upon him, and he excuses himself saying he lied three lies. Then they come to Musa (Moses), peace be upon him, after that, and he excuses himself saying he killed a soul he was not commanded to kill. Then they come to Isa (Jesus), peace be upon him, and he does not offer an excuse, but he acknowledges the virtue of the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, saying to them: Go to Muhammad, peace and blessings be upon him, a servant whose past and future sins Allah has forgiven. So they come to the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, and ask him for intercession. He intercedes to Allah Almighty, and Allah Almighty descends to judge between the servants. This intercession is called the Great Intercession, and it is from the Praiseworthy Station (Maqam Mahmud) about which Allah said: {It may be that your Lord will raise you to a Praised Station (79)} [Al-Isra: 79]. So the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, intercedes to Allah Almighty, and Allah Almighty descends to judge between His servants and relieves them from this standing (1). Second: From the intercession exclusive to the Messenger, peace and blessings be upon him, is that he intercedes for the people of Paradise to enter Paradise. For when the people of Paradise cross the Sirat and reach the gate of Paradise, they find it closed. So the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, intercedes to Allah to open the gate of Paradise for them. Allah indicated this intercession saying: {And those who feared their Lord will be driven to Paradise in groups; until when they reach it while its gates have been opened} [Surah Az-Zumar: 73], and He did not say: until when they reach it, they were opened, as He said regarding the Fire: {And those who disbelieved will be driven to Hell in groups; until when they reach it, its gates are opened} [Surah Az-Zumar: 71]. But regarding the people of Paradise He said: {while its gates have been opened}; because they are not opened except after intercession. Third: His intercession, peace and blessings be upon him, for his uncle Abu Talib that the punishment be lightened for him.
foot_note: 1. Sahih Muslim, Book of Faith, Chapter: Intercession, (3/ 53 - 58 - with Al-Nawawi's explanation).

book_title: The Doctrine of Belief in the Last Day and Its Effect on Reforming Society
text: General Intercession: As for that in which intercession is general, for him and for all Prophets, Truthful ones, Martyrs, and Righteous people, it is of types: First: Intercession for the people of the Fire among the believers that they be brought out of the Fire. Second: Intercession for those among the believers who deserved the Fire that they do not enter the Fire. Third: Intercession to raise the ranks of some people of Paradise. Fourth: Intercession for those whose good deeds and bad deeds were equal, that they enter Paradise. Fifth: Intercession for the entry of some believers into Paradise without reckoning or punishment (1). Intercession must have three conditions. First: Allah's pleasure with the intercessor. Then: His pleasure with the one interceded for. Then: His permission. Allah Almighty said: {And how many angels there are in the heavens whose intercession will not avail at all except [only] after Allah has permitted [it] to whom He wills and approves (26)} [An-Najm: 26], and He Almighty said: {And they cannot intercede except on behalf of one whom He approves} [Al-Anbiya: 28]. Topic Eight: The Bridge (Al-Sirat) And included in belief in the Last Day is: The Sirat. It is a bridge extended over the Fire. People pass over it according to their deeds. Some of them pass like the blink of an eye, some pass like lightning, some pass like the wind, according to their deeds. Whoever was quick in the world to accept the truth and act upon it will be quicker in crossing the Sirat. And the slower a person was to accept the truth and act upon it, the slower he will be on the Sirat. The people of Paradise pass over this Sirat and cross it. As for the disbelievers, they do not pass over it, because they are driven to the Fire - and we seek refuge in Allah -, coming to it thirsty. From Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri, may Allah be pleased with him, describing the crossing of the Sirat, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: «Then the bridge is laid across Hell, and intercession is allowed, and they say: O Allah, save, save. It was said: O Messenger of Allah! What is the bridge? He said: A slippery slope (2) containing hooks, claws, and thorns (3) like in Najd which has a small thorn called Al-Sa'dan. The believers pass like the blink of an eye, like lightning, like wind, like birds, and like excellent horses and camels. So one is saved safe, one is scratched but released, and one is piled into the fire of Hell» (4).

2. Dahd and Mazalla mean the same thing, which is the place where feet slip and do not stabilize. Al-Nawawi's explanation of Sahih Muslim (3/ 29). 
3. Hasak: Hard thorns made of iron. Al-Nawawi's explanation of Sahih Muslim (3/ 29). 
4. Sahih Muslim, Book of Faith, Chapter: The last of the people of Paradise to enter (3/ 25 - 34).

book_title: The Doctrine of Belief in the Last Day and Its Effect on Reforming Society
text: Topic: Entering Paradise or Fire It is the last of stages, where the people of Paradise enter Paradise, and the people of Fire enter the Fire. Here we reach the end of the line... the end of the long journey, a part of which began on earth in the worldly life, and today reaches its end after Resurrection, Gathering, Presentation, and Questioning. Allah Almighty said: {As He began you, so you will return (29) A group He guided, and a group deserved [to be in] error} [Surah Al-A'raf: 29-30]. Here the picture is complete, the truth is established, and everything reaches settlement. As for those who were steadfast on the path in their worldly life, believed in Allah, adhered to His commands, were certain of the Day of meeting Him, avoided His wrath, strove for His pleasure, toiled and labored for that, endured what they endured of hardship, and were patient over what they met of harm and fatigue on the path, those have deserved Allah's pleasure and His Paradise, and deserved to reach the Abode of Safety where nothing worries, nothing frightens, and nothing disturbs the bliss: {They will not taste death therein except the first death, and He will have protected them from the punishment of Hellfire (56)} [Ad-Dukhan: 56]. As for those who disbelieved and lied, persisted in their error, disobeyed the command of their Lord and His messengers, enjoyed the worldly life unjustly, toiled but for Satan, and rejoiced in their wrong deeds so they became tyrannical and arrogant with them, they have deserved to reach Hell, where there is no death nor life, and not even a day of punishment is lightened for them. Paradise and Fire exist right now. Allah Almighty said - regarding the Fire -: {And fear the Fire, which has been prepared for the disbelievers (131)} [Ali Imran: 131], and preparation means making ready. And regarding Paradise, Allah Almighty said: {And hasten to forgiveness from your Lord and a garden as wide as the heavens and earth, prepared for the righteous (133)} [Ali Imran: 133], and preparation also means making ready. In Sahih Muslim and others in the story of the solar eclipse, the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, stood to pray and Paradise and Fire were displayed to him. He saw Paradise until he intended to take a cluster [of grapes] from it, then it appeared to him not to do so, peace and blessings be upon him. And he saw the Fire and saw in it Amr bin Luhayy Al-Khuza'i dragging his intestines - meaning his bowels - in the Fire, having spilled out of his stomach, so he drags them - we seek refuge in Allah - in the fire of Hell (1), which indicates that Paradise and Fire exist right now.
foot_note: 1. Sahih Muslim, Book of Eclipses, Chapter: What was displayed to the Prophet – peace and blessings be upon him in the Eclipse Prayer (6/ 206 - with Al-Nawawi's explanation).

book_title: The Doctrine of Belief in the Last Day and Its Effect on Reforming Society
text: Paradise and Fire remain; Paradise remains for ever and ever, and the Fire remains for ever and ever. Allah Almighty said: {(6) Indeed, they who have believed and done righteous deeds - those are the best of creatures. (7) Their reward with Allah will be gardens of perpetual residence beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide forever, Allah being pleased with them and they with Him. That is for whoever has feared his Lord (8)} [Surah Al-Bayyinah: 7-8]. Regarding the Fire, Allah mentioned eternity in three verses of the Quran. Allah Almighty said: {Indeed, those who disbelieve and commit wrong [or injustice] - never will Allah forgive them, nor will He guide them to a path. (168) Except the path of Hell; they will abide therein forever} [Surah An-Nisa: 168-169]. And He Almighty said: {Indeed, Allah has cursed the disbelievers and prepared for them a Blaze. (64) Abiding therein forever} [Surah Al-Ahzab: 64-65]. And He Almighty said: {And whoever disobeys Allah and His Messenger - then indeed, for him is the fire of Hell; they will abide therein forever (23)} [Al-Jinn: 23]. So the Fire and Paradise exist now, and they remain, and they never perish.
foot_note: None

book_title: The Doctrine of Belief in the Last Day and Its Effect on Reforming Society
text: Chapter Four: The Effects of Belief in the Last Day on Reforming Society Belief in the Last Day is a pillar of faith, and a fundamental doctrine of Islam. The issue of Resurrection in the Hereafter is what the structure of creed stands upon after the issue of the Oneness of Allah Almighty. Belief in what is in the Last Day and its signs is belief in the Unseen which the intellect cannot perceive, and there is no way to know it except by text through Revelation. Hardly do you pass a page of the Quran without finding in it a discussion about the Last Day and what is in it of reward and punishment. The true life in Islam is not just this short limited worldly life, nor is it only the short limited life span of a human. True life in Islam extends in time to eternity, and extends in place to another abode in a Paradise as wide as the heavens and earth, or a Fire spacious enough for many generations that populated the face of the earth for eras of years. Allah Almighty said: {Race toward forgiveness from your Lord and a Garden whose width is like the width of the heavens and earth, prepared for those who believed in Allah and His messengers} [Al-Hadid: 21]. And He Almighty said: {On the Day We will say to Hell, "Have you been filled?" and it will say, "Are there any more?" (30)} [Qaf: 30]. Belief in the Last Day has extreme importance in human life and profound effects. We can understand in light of this fact that the Quran linked in many places between belief in Allah and belief in the Last Day. Allah Almighty said: {They believe in Allah and the Last Day, and they enjoin what is right and forbid what is wrong} [Ali Imran: 114]. And He Almighty said: {That is instructed to whoever of you believes in Allah and the Last Day} [At-Talaq: 2]. So belief in the Last Day is directly linked to belief in Allah. Indeed, belief in Allah and the Last Day and what is in it of reward and punishment is the true guide for human behavior towards the path of good. There is no human law that can make human behavior upright and straight as belief in the Last Day does. Therefore, there is a big difference and a vast gap between the behavior of one who believes in Allah and the Last Day, and knows that the world is the plantation for the Hereafter, and that righteous deeds are the provision for the Hereafter, as Allah Almighty said: {And take provisions, but indeed, the best provision is piety} [Al-Baqarah: 197].
foot_note: None

book_title: The Doctrine of Belief in the Last Day and Its Effect on Reforming Society
text: The one who believes in the Day of Judgment works while looking at the scale of Heaven, not the scale of Earth, and for the account of the Hereafter, not the account of the world. He has unique behavior in life; we see in him uprightness, breadth of vision, strength of faith, firmness in adversities, and patience over calamities, seeking reward and recompense, for he knows that what is with Allah is better and more lasting. Imam Muslim narrated from Suhayb, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: «Amazing is the affair of the believer! Indeed, all of his affair is good, and that is not for anyone except the believer. If prosperity strikes him, he is grateful, and that is good for him. And if adversity strikes him, he is patient, and that is good for him...» (1). This feeling is from the effects of belief in Allah and the Last Day, and the sense of the heavy responsibility and the greatness of the Trust which man bore and from which the heavens, the earth, and the mountains shied away. For he knows that every big and small thing he is responsible for, accountable for, and recompensed for; if good then good, and if evil then evil. {The Day every soul will find what it has done of good present [before it] and what it has done of evil, it will wish that between itself and that [evil] was a great distance} [Ali Imran: 30]. And He Almighty said: {And the record [of deeds] will be placed, and you will see the criminals fearful of that within it, and they will say, "Oh, woe to us! What is this book that leaves nothing small or great except that it has enumerated it?" And they will find what they did present [before them]. And your Lord does injustice to no one (49)} [Al-Kahf: 49]. As for the one who does not believe in Allah nor in the Last Day and what is in it of reckoning and recompense, he tries hard to achieve his goals in the worldly life, panting after its pleasures, scrambling to collect it, preventing good from reaching people through him. He has made the world his greatest concern and the limit of his knowledge. He measures matters by his private benefit; he does not care about others, nor does he pay attention to his fellow humans except within the limits of what achieves benefit for him in this short limited life. He moves while his boundaries are the earth and the limits of this lifespan. Hence, his calculation changes, the results of his scales differ, and he ends up with wrong results, because he considers Resurrection unlikely {But man desires to continue in sin. (5) He asks, "When is the Day of Resurrection?" (6)} [Surah Al-Qiyamah: 5-6]. You find this type of people among the most eager of people for life, because they do not believe in Resurrection after death, as He Almighty said describing the polytheists among the Jews and others: {And you will surely find them the most greedy of people for life - [even] more than those who associate others with Allah. One of them wishes that he could be granted life a thousand years, but it would not remove him in the least from the punishment that he should be granted life. And Allah is Seeing of what they do (96)} [Al-Baqarah: 96].
foot_note: 1. Sahih Muslim, Book of Asceticism, Chapter: Miscellaneous Hadiths (18/ 125 - with Al-Nawawi's explanation).

book_title: The Doctrine of Belief in the Last Day and Its Effect on Reforming Society
text: For the polytheist does not hope for resurrection after death, so he loves long life. And the Jew has known what disgrace awaits him in the Hereafter due to what he did with the knowledge he has (1). So this kind and those like them are the worst of people. You find spreading among them: greed, avarice, oppression of peoples, enslaving them, and looting their wealth, out of their eagerness to enjoy the pleasures of the worldly life. Therefore, moral decay and bestial behavior appear among them. If they see the worldly life's troubles and pains exceed what they hope for of immediate pleasures, they have no barrier preventing them from committing suicide. They do not value responsibility in another life, so they have nothing preventing them from ending this life. For this reason, Islam cared, and emphasis came in the Quran on the issue of belief in the Last Day, and proving Resurrection, Reckoning, and Recompense. It denied the ignorant ones' deeming it unlikely, and commanded its Prophet to swear that it is true: {Say, "Yes, by my Lord, you will surely be resurrected; then you will surely be informed of what you did. And that, for Allah, is easy." (7)} [At-Taghabun: 7]. And it mentioned the conditions of the Day of Resurrection, what He prepared for His pious servants of reward, and what He prepared for the disobedient of punishment. It drew the attention of the deniers to the proofs of its reality, to uproot doubt from the souls, and so that people place this Day and its hair-raising horrors before their eyes, so their behavior in this life becomes upright by following the true religion brought to them by their Messenger, peace and blessings be upon him (2). Indeed, correct belief in Allah and all that came from Allah, and belief in the Messenger of Allah and all that came from the Messenger of Allah has fruits. Ripe fruits, good delicious fruits. Fruits that are the joy of souls, nourishment of spirits, and tranquility of the heart. Among them is saying "La ilaha illa Allah Muhammad Rasul Allah" with knowledge, certainty, truthfulness, sincerity, love, acceptance, and submission. Among the fruits of faith and affirmation is doing all obligations and leaving all prohibitions. And judging by the laws of Islamic Sharia, and removing man-made laws. Among the fruits is enjoining good and forbidding evil, fulfilling covenants and pacts, performing trusts, adorning oneself with patience and truthfulness, righteousness and kindness, maintaining ties of kinship, kindness to parents, loving believers and hating disbelievers, piety, certainty, fear of the Lord of the Worlds, giving full measure and weight, giving sincere advice to Allah, His Messenger, His servants, and the leaders of Muslims, compassion, sympathy, and mercy for the poor, orphans, and needy, asceticism and piety, truthful dealing with Allah, spending generously, and refraining from harm. All of that is from the fruits of faith and affirmation.

1. See: Tafsir Ibn Kathir (1/ 184). 
2. See: Ashrat al-Sa'ah, pp. 27 - 33.

book_title: The Doctrine of Belief in the Last Day and Its Effect on Reforming Society
text: So what made the Muslims endure harm and be patient over affliction? It is belief in Allah Almighty and the Last Day, the belief whose source is from the core of the hearts. Among the fruits of faith is that Allah Almighty takes the believers as allies. Allah Almighty said: {Indeed, the most worthy of Abraham among the people are those who followed him [in submission to Allah] and this prophet, and those who believe [in his message]. And Allah is the ally of the believers (68)} [Ali Imran: 68]. And whoever Allah takes as an ally is happy in this world and the Hereafter. Among the fruits of faith is what Allah informed about His believing servants, He Almighty said: {Indeed, the righteous will be among gardens and springs, (15) Accepting what their Lord has given them. Indeed, they were before that doers of good. (16) They used to sleep but little of the night, (17) And in the hours before dawn they would ask forgiveness, (18) And from their properties was [given] the right of the [needy] petitioner and the deprived (19)} [Surah Adh-Dhariyat: 15-19]. Among the fruits of faith is the desire to perform obedience and eagerness for it hoping for the reward of that Day. Among the fruits of faith is the fear of committing sin and accepting it, and distancing from prohibitions and all evils out of fear of the punishment of that Day. Among the fruits of faith is consoling the believer for what he misses of the world by what he hopes for of the Hereafter's bliss and reward (1). Among the fruits of faith is that the angels of the Most Merciful pray for and ask forgiveness for the believers. Allah Almighty said: {Those [angels] who carry the Throne and those around it exalt [Allah] with praise of their Lord and believe in Him and ask forgiveness for those who have believed, [saying], "Our Lord, You have encompassed all things in mercy and knowledge, so forgive those who have repented and followed Your way and protect them from the punishment of Hellfire (7)} [Ghafir: 7] (2), and other fruits.
foot_note:
1. See: Sharh Usul Al-Iman, Muhammad bin Uthaymeen, p. 46, 1st ed., Dar Al-Watan, Riyadh, 1410 AH. 
2. See: 'Aqidat Al-Muslimin wa Al-Radd 'ala Al-Mulhidin, Salih Al-Balayhi (1/ 50 - 55), 1st ed., Al-Matabi' Al-Ahliyah, Riyadh, 1401 AH.

book_title: The Doctrine of Belief in the Last Day and Its Effect on Reforming Society
text: Conclusion After this, it has become clear to us through this research that the foundation upon which the rectification of the individual - who is the building block of society - stands is the correct creed and firm belief in Allah Almighty, and what follows that of belief in Resurrection and Recompense for the deeds that occurred from the accountable ones in this life. This is because belief in the Last Day has importance in reforming societies and stabilizing their conditions, for there is no happiness for a society whose individuals do not believe in the Last Day and the Day of Recompense and Reckoning. The Holy Quran has clarified that the existence of this human on this earth is not in vain, rather Allah Almighty created him for a purpose and wisdom. Allah Almighty said: {Then did you think that We created you uselessly} [Al-Mu'minun: 115], meaning the matter is not so; rather there is a goal, and there is a purpose for this life. So there must be a return to Allah Almighty after the journey of this human in this worldly life. Allah Almighty said: {O people, if you are in doubt about the Resurrection, then indeed, We created you from dust, then from a sperm-drop, then from a clinging clot, and then from a lump of flesh, formed and unformed - that We may show you. And We settle in the wombs whom We will for a specified term, then We bring you out as a child, and then [We develop you] that you may reach your [time of] maturity. And among you is he who is taken in [early] death, and among you is he who is returned to the most decrepit [old] age so that he knows, after [once having] knowledge, nothing. And you see the earth barren, but when We send down upon it rain, it quivers and swells and grows [something] of every beautiful kind. (5) That is because Allah is the Truth and because He gives life to the dead and because He is over all things competent (6) And [that] the Hour is coming - no doubt about it - and that Allah will resurrect those in the graves (7)} [Surah Al-Hajj: 5-7]. And that the believer must submit and believe in everything that came in the Book and the Sunnah regarding unseen matters. And that reason and sound nature indicate the occurrence of Resurrection and Rising. O Allah, we ask You for Paradise and what draws near to it of words and deeds, and we seek refuge in You from the Fire and what draws near to it of words and deeds. Our Lord, do not let our hearts deviate after You have guided us and grant us from Yourself mercy. Indeed, You are the Bestower. And may Allah send blessings and peace upon our Prophet Muhammad and upon his family and companions.
